solution_line_template: Rose cooked {initial_rice_kg} x {morning_fraction} = <<{initial_rice_kg}*{morning_fraction}={morning_cooked_kg}>>{morning_cooked_kg} kilograms of rice in the morning.
She had {initial_rice_kg} - {morning_cooked_kg} = <<{initial_rice_kg}-{morning_cooked_kg}={rice_left_kg}>>{rice_left_kg} kilogram of rice left then.
One kilogram is equal to {rice_left_kg} x {grams_per_kg} = <<{rice_left_kg}*{grams_per_kg}={rice_left_g}>>{rice_left_g} grams.
So, Rose cooked {rice_left_g} x {evening_fraction} = <<{rice_left_g}*{evening_fraction}={evening_cooked_g}>>{evening_cooked_g} grams of rice in the evening.
Therefore, she has {rice_left_g} - {evening_cooked_g} = <<{rice_left_g}-{evening_cooked_g}={rice_left_after_evening_g}>>{rice_left_after_evening_g} grams of rice left.
